## REUPLOAD THE MARKDOWN (ON CANVAS) EVERYTIME YOU MAKE CHANGES PLS 
## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
df = read.csv("TurbineGroup2.csv")
high_energy <- df[df$TEY >= 160,]
low_energy <- df[(df$TEY >= 130 & df$TEY <= 136),]
all_predictors_model <- lm(NOX ~ . - CO -AP -AT -AH -TEY, data = df)
summary(all_predictors_model)
high_energy_model <- lm(NOX ~ . - CO -AP -AT -AH -TEY, data = high_energy)
summary(high_energy_model)
low_energy_model <- lm(NOX ~ . - CO -AP -AT -AH -TEY, data = low_energy)
summary(low_energy_model)
high_environmental_model <- lm(NOX ~ AP + AT + AH, data = high_energy)
summary(high_environmental_model)
low_evironmental_model <- lm(NOX ~ AP + AT + AH, data = low_energy)
summary(low_evironmental_model)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(high_energy, aes(AFDP, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "AFDP", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(GTEP, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "GTEP", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(TIT, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "TIT", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(TAT, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "TAT", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(CDP, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "CDP", y = "NOX")
```

```{r}
ggplot(high_energy, aes(AT, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "AT", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(AP, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "AP", y = "NOX")

ggplot(high_energy, aes(AH, NOX)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  labs(x = "AH", y = "NOX")
```


```{r}
ggplot(low_energy, aes(AT, NOX)) +

  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +

ggplot(low_energy, aes(AP, NOX)) +

ggplot(low_energy, aes(AH, NOX)) +

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
